content:
Hi

Sometimes I spend a couple of days without opening Zulip chat and there are tons of unread messages. I try to read a couple and dismiss the popup asking me to mark all as read. But when I get tired of reading, I just want to skip to the end and I have never found a button to do that, so I kept scrolling the messages. I have found the option to mark all messages as read on the left menu but I don't think is very intuitive. Wouldn't be better if that option was somewhere near the message area?
Well, there are tradeoffs here. You can scroll to the bottom of a message view or use the End key to do that for an individual view (which in the "All messages" view marks everything as read)
But we do need to be cautious about making it too easy to accidentally mark everything as read.

One thing we're likely to do very soon is a change similar to d79a7a8c35bdfbe8dd776f8c0acb6069422d2d7c replacing the modal for unread messages; I think that should be a fairly quick change for anyone interested, and will help a lot since users can just leave that notice up until they're ready to hit it.

yeah I was thinking in something like that actually. When I finish the issue I'm currently working on, if none still hasn't done this I could do it :)
Should I open an issue for this?
